column1: Unbelievable. @SpeakerPelosi would rather pass nothing-and let those still struggling twist in the wind-than pass even extensions of programs we previously passed. This was never about COVID relief. It was only about political posturing for the election. https://t.co/2Yc6InfDsL

The President's actions to restrict travel from China in the early days of the coronavirus pandemic saved lives. Now Democrats want to limit that authority and make it more difficult to keep America safe with the irresponsible #NoBanAct https://t.co/LpBNaiRtEz

.@RepMarcyKaptur & I worked together to introduce bipartisan bill helping hospitals & healthcare providers to forgive loans made preparing for #COVID19 pandemic. Those on #COVID19 front lines need back-up! https://t.co/SxGaU6zks9

@AMPmaritime  recently recognized siblings Sissy and Gary Payment of Ohio’s @InterlakeSSCo as two of the nearly 14000 maritime workers in Ohio that keep our economy moving during the coronavirus pandemic. https://t.co/SE7s84eH6O
Watch Ohio’s own @TireSource tomorrow on @QVC at 12N & 9PM or @HSN 1:55PM & 10:55PM. @NRFnews & @QurateRetailGrp sharing stories on retailers affected by coronavirus.

Thank you to @RepConorLamb for joining me to spearhead this bipartisan effort. Transportation infrastructure is truly essential funding shortfalls from #COVID19 will leave state DOTs with budget deficits & unfunded incomplete or abandoned infrastructure improvement projects. https://t.co/hUw7OPSSjm

State DOTs rely so much on fuel taxes and tolls. When the nation begins returning to normal and surface transportation traffic returns to pre-coronavirus levels the reduction in revenue may leave important projects incomplete or unfunded without a boost. https://t.co/ZIad2Hdqvz

Great to see ⁦@NFL⁩ ⁦@Browns⁩ & ⁦@ArbysFoundation⁩ working to provide ⁦@CLEMetroSchools⁩ students with free WiFi so they can stay engaged & continue their education during the #COVID19 pandemic! https://t.co/DXeoIZiVnE

Thank you to @RepBeatty @RepTimRyan @RepMikeTurner @RepAGonzalez @RepMarciaFudge @RepSteveStivers @RepBillJohnson @RepBalderson @RepDaveJoyce for joining @RepMarcyKaptur & me to fight for loan relief for hospitals hurt by #COVID19 https://t.co/wlns6P4OFY

Ohio has gotten tremendous federal assistance thanks to @realDonaldTrump & @WhiteHouse during the coronavirus crisis! @fema’s Project Air Bridge and Strategic National Stockpile is delivering millions of assorted PPE keeping us prepared!
.@LindseyGrahamSC is right. We cannot forget China’s role in the spread of #COVID19 read my op-ed at @RichlandSource for more - https://t.co/wxXMuFUECs https://t.co/boTEN43kgV

THREE of which were created by the CARES Act specifically for coronavirus oversight. @SpeakerPelosi's goal isn't oversight it is extracting political capital out of a public health crisis. https://t.co/3SU1iSmxjB

From transit workers to utility workers and more the T&I Committee thanks you for your work as our nation battles #COVID19. The essential job you do keeps our country moving and brings us one step closer to overcoming this global pandemic. #ToThoseWhoKeepUsMoving https://t.co/WKybwpCbWf

As our nation battles the coronavirus pandemic essential workers continue to show up and keep America moving. A special thanks to the men and women of @uscg who continue to serve our nation and keep America secure. #ToThoseWhoKeepUsMoving https://t.co/ghmE5f65Ul

Thanks to the housing industry & @NAHBhome for hosting a safety stand down today emphasizing importance of essential industries practicing COVID-19 safety precautions like keeping workers six feet apart & keeping equipment sanitized on the job site  #NAHB #safetystanddown

The entire world is working together to fight #COVID19! Our friends in Taiwan are donating 10 million masks & other supplies to other nations including 50000 masks coming to Ohio! https://t.co/zfXOS42p1r

This should surprise no one. It's why I signed on to support @RepJimBanks' resolution calling China out for among many things: denying COVID19's person-to-person transmission capability & waging an outrageous & false propaganda war that blames the US for creating the virus. https://t.co/UkDot74K26
It is incumbent upon Congress to support those fighting to stop the spread of the coronavirus & the millions of Americans suffering from loss of work. The CARES Act does exactly that.
The CARES Act is a critical phase 3 in the federal response to the coronavirus outbreak. By beefing up funding directly to hospitals they can ramp up the capacity to diagnose and treat patients.

A #coronavirus side effect you might not have considered: Canceled blood drives & fewer blood donations. We need healthy eligible individuals to schedule a @RedCross blood donation appointment to help overcome a severe blood shortage: https://t.co/1Q2km4Fyei #COVID19

I'll be on @1480whbc with Bill Morgan this morning at 10:15 to discuss the latest on the coronavirus & Congress' plans to provide relief for the workers families businesses and non-profits affected by the coronavirus outbreak. You can listen live at https://t.co/zk8zH56MDF
The next few weeks are critical in keeping the coronavirus from spreading! Limit your exposure! #15daystoslowthespread https://t.co/DRDVuLEYJ0

If you're quarantined by a doctor or your employer is shut down because of #coronavirus you may be eligible for unemployment benefits. @clevelanddotcom provides a guide on how to apply. ⬇️ https://t.co/XnizjOv6D0

It should be as simple as passing bipartisan legislation to provide relief for those affected by #Coronavirus. But Nancy Pelosi has been wasting time trying to stuff a relief bill w/ items from liberal wish lists. It's time to get serious and put the American people over politics https://t.co/M6XemN1c3Y

The first cases of #coronavirus have been identified in Ohio. I’ve created a comprehensive resource for #OH7 constituents. Get all the information you need to prevent getting and spreading the disease here: https://t.co/EHkBPdomLJ

As Ohio experiences its first #coronavirus cases I’ve compiled a variety of resources from many sources to help Ohioans navigate and be prepared during the outbreak. Visit my website for regularly updated information. https://t.co/ocwptfvzxb

Appreciate talking to Rex Coombs at WDPN this morning to discuss the latest on the coronavirus and the House’s bill that provides emergency funding to CDC NIH and state & local health agencies to deal with the situation. https://t.co/dsvFydH9De

Now is not the time for political posturing. Dems need to stop trying to sneak in poison pills to coronavirus funding.  It’s time to put up a CLEAN funding bill. Time to put public health first not politics. https://t.co/JQCxAo8V7F
It’s time to put politics aside and make sure our public health agencies remain prepared to handle the coronavirus.
